intro: Physaria pinetorum subsp. iveyana, commonly known as the Sierra madre bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants. This subspecies is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces distinctive, inflated seed pods that contain several small, rounded seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
